availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Willoughby Sanford Scott (Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and slave trader)

body.p: Bourbon County, Kentucky, farmer and slave trader. Kentucky native. Married Margaret A. Lindsay Scott. Father of Lucinda Scott, Mary E. Scott, and Louisa Scott. Farmer in Bourbon County in 1850. Slave trader in Paris, Kentucky, in 1860.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, District 1, p. 292; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bourbon County, Paris, p. 3; KYR-0001-029-0537.
